channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Reidemeister's theorem using transversality
item.description: arXiv:2406.18203v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We recover Reidemeister's theorem using smooth functions and transversality.
item.dc:creator: Hoel Queffelec

item.title: Unstability problem of real analytic maps
item.description: arXiv:2406.18106v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: As well-known, the $C^\infty$ stability of proper $C^\infty$ maps is characterized by the infinitesimal $C^\infty$ stability. In the present paper we study the counterpart in real analytic context. In particular, we show that the infinitesimal $C^\omega$ stability does not imply $C^\omega$ stability; for instance, a Whitney umbrella $\mathbb{R}^2 \to \mathbb{R}^3$ is not $C^\omega$ stable. A main tool for the proof is a relative version of Whitney's Analytic Approximation Theorem which is shown by using H. Cartan's Theorems A and B.
item.dc:creator: Karim Bekka, Satoshi Koike, Toru Ohmoto, Masahiro Shiota, Masato Tanabe

item.title: Geometrical finiteness for automorphism groups via cone conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2406.18438v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper aims to establish the geometrical finiteness for the natural isometric actions of (birational) automorphism groups on the hyperbolic spaces for K3 surfaces, Enriques surfaces, Coble surfaces, and irreducible symplectic varieties. As an application, it can be seen that such groups are non-positively curved: ${\rm CAT(0)}$ and relatively hyperbolic. In the case of K3 surfaces, we additionally provide a dynamical characterization of the relative hyperbolicity, and the first counterexample to Mukai's conjecture concerning the virtual cohomological dimension of automorphism groups.
item.dc:creator: Kohei Kikuta

item.title: Cobordism Obstructions to Complex Sections II: Torsion Obstructions
item.description: arXiv:2406.18520v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In the previous paper, we studied the existence of complex sections on almost complex manifolds up to cobordism. We proved a necessary and sufficient condition for their existence in $\Omega_{*}^U\otimes \mathbb{Q}$ in terms of the Chern classes. In this paper we study the existence question in $\Omega^{U}_*$. We call corresponding obstructions torsion and we determine them for small values of $r$. Calculations with the Adams-Novikov spectral sequence for the Thom spectra defined in the previous paper allow us to show the vanishing of the torsion obstruction for low $r$. For prime $p$, we show the vanishing of $p$ torsion obstructions for finding $r$ complex sections for $r<p^2-p$.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Nguyen

item.title: Farber's conjecture and beyond
item.description: arXiv:2402.03022v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We survey two decades of work on the (sequential) topological complexity of configuration spaces of graphs (ordered and unordered), aiming to give an account that is unifying, elementary, and self-contained. We discuss the traditional approach through cohomology, with its limitations, and the more modern approach through asphericity and the fundamental group, explaining how they are in fact variations on the same core ideas. We close with a list of open problems in the field.
item.dc:creator: Ben Knudsen

item.title: Corks
item.description: arXiv:2406.15369v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Remarks relating the various notions of corks.
item.dc:creator: Selman Akbulut
